intro: Scrophularia nahavendii, commonly known as Nahavend scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes numerous species with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant typically features slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, adapted to its arid and mountainous habitat. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive two-lipped structure typical of the family. Scrophularia nahavendii is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
